bibl.title: Fletcher Decker v. State of Washington. Warrant to Apprehend
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: To all or any of the Peace Officers in the said Province:
Insert full name, residence, and occupation of accused.

WHEREAS Fletcher Decker formerly of near Wiwa Hill Post Office, of in the said Province, was on the 14th day of June A.D. 1921 charged upon oath before the undersigned A. J. G. MacEchen, a Justice of the Peace in and for the said Province, for that he, on the or about the 15th day of November A.D. 1915, near Wiwa Hill Post Office, aforesaid in the said Province, did steal about Three Hundred (300) bushels of flax the property of Claude Ficklin and was thereby guilty of theft.

THESE ARE THEREFORE TO COMMAN YOU, in His Majesty's name forthwith to apprehend the said Fletcher Decker and to bring him before me, or some other Justice of the Peace in and for the said Province, to answer unto the said charge and to be further dealt with according to law.
GIVEN under my hand and seal this 5th day of August A.D. 1921, at Regina in the Province aforesaid.
A Justice of the Peace in and for the Province of Saskatchewan.
